summary: Custom logger passed to Runtime.install() wasn't being used by webpack for build-time logging. Webpack logs were emitted via console.error instead of flowing through the configured logger entry function.
userImpact: Users unable to centralize webpack build logs through their custom logging infrastructure, breaking log aggregation and formatting consistency.
rootCause: Webpack logger doesn't use the installed Runtime logger; logs are emitted directly via console.error instead of going through the configured entry function.
workaround: Manually call bundleWorkflowCode instead of relying on Worker.create's automatic bundling, though this doesn't require instantiating the Runtime.
resolutionDetails: Issue was confirmed to have been fixed in a later version; webpack output now routes through the custom logger when Worker.create initiates bundling.
keyQuote: Logs are emitted using `console.error`, instead of the custom entry function passed to the `DefaultLogger` passed to `Runtime.install`
